title: ICS 4.0.4 update on Sprint Disables Linking Volume
comment: I loved this App when I was on GB since it linked my ringer and notification volumes and tied them both to the phone's volume rocker. When in a meeting I could turn down my volumes quickly without thought and not be interrupted by a loud text. Sprint recently rolled out the ICS update to this Samsung Galaxy S2 (Epic Touch) and now the linking is broken. ICS is supposed to, by default, have the two linked but perhaps this was changed by Samsung or Sprint. There are other threads with people having the same problem and it appears to be specific to Samsung though I don't know that for sure. In any event, the app no longer functions correctly after the ICS 4.0.4 update. It will NOT link the notification volume to the ringer volume, so when using the volume rocker only my ringer volume is changed and I am left with very loud and irritating text notifications. I hope there can be a fix for this soon. Thanks for a great app otherwise!

title: Volume control on Galaxy S3
comment: On the Galaxy S3 it seems the volume control for Ringer and Message sounds seem to be somehow linked in this Quick Settings app and the tickbox to unlink them does not work. I know it says on the What´s New page that this is a system restriction, but in the phone itself they are not linked at all. Apart from that, a nice app.  Additional:  The app "Audio Control"  here in the store does have Ringer and Notifications volume separated, so it does seem technically possible for 3rd party apps to unlink them. As mentioned before, the standard volume control in S3 has a different slider for Ringer and Notifications, so if they are not linked in the phone and in other apps then why are they linked in this app ?
